key_channel_insights.line_content: Price parity remains high at 95.3 %, yet ‘website offer not found’ jumped to 2.6 % of itineraries (+222 % WoW), signalling a growing visibility issue.
MSE undercuts occur on 53 % of OD pairs, but the average discount is just –0.14 %, indicating the risk is volume-driven rather than depth-driven.
GDS holds 88 % parity; premiums surface on 10 % of ODs at only +0.3 %, but long-haul and non-MX origins show double the network premium frequency.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Despite a 1.9 ppt slip, 95.3 % of OTA itineraries still match website fares, maintaining strong alignment.
‘Website fare missing’ rose from 0.4 % to 2.6 % of itineraries (+222 % WoW), driven by close-in short-haul searches.
OTAs priced above the site on 1.8 % of itineraries (–0.6 ppt WoW), reducing customer price-perception risk.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: At 2.6 % of itineraries, ‘website offer not found’ is now the top non-parity concern and up 157 % MoM.
Same-price share at 95.3 % but trending downward by ~1.5 ppts vs both prior periods.
OTAs cheaper on only 0.3 % of itineraries; nonetheless the share doubled WoW and merits monitoring.
Channel-higher cases dropped to 1.8 %, signalling progress on OTA over-pricing.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 95.2 %; missing offers 2.7 %—the main source of recent content gaps.
Parity 96.5 %; both missing offers and OTA premiums at 1.8 %—low but worth watching.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Offer gaps rose to 2.7 % (+2.3 ppts WoW); OTA undercuts still limited at 0.3 %.
Higher OTA premiums (2.3 %) and equal share of missing offers indicate weaker international coverage.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity down to 93.5 %; missing offers 3.8 % and premiums 2.2 %—risking last-minute sales.
Near-perfect parity (99.2 %), zero gaps, and minimal premiums (0.8 %).

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE cheaper on 53 % of OD pairs, though incidence fell 1.3 ppts WoW and 2.4 ppts MoM.
Average undercut is just –0.14 %, limiting revenue dilution per ticket.
MSE higher than the site on only 0.04 % of OD pairs and shrinking further.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Zero ‘website offer not found’ cases eliminate visibility risk in MSE.
Parity reached 47 % (+1.7 ppts WoW); progressive alignment evident.
Still the largest bucket at 53 %, but downward trend and shallow –0.14 % gap soften impact.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 50 % undercuts at –0.13 %; parity up 1.6 ppts WoW.
93 % of long-haul OD pairs cheaper on MSE (–0.20 %); most material disparity despite recent 3 ppt improvement.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 53 %, undercuts 47 % (–0.12 %); undercutting down 1.2 ppts WoW.
Undercutting nearly universal at 98 % (–0.20 %); parity remains scarce.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity leads at 70 %; undercuts down to 31 % with a mild –0.11 % gap.

gds_highlights.line_content: 88 % of GDS fares match the website; stability within ±0.4 ppt over the month.
GDS higher on 10 % of ODs, average uplift +0.3 %, limiting revenue risk.
Premium frequency roughly doubles to ~20 % in these segments, warranting targeted audits.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: ‘Website offer not found’ only 0.16 % of ODs and falling.
88.3 % parity, –0.6 ppt WoW but +0.4 ppt MoM.
Channel lower on 1.6 % of ODs at –0.2 %; decreasing slowly.
GDS higher on 9.9 % of ODs (+1.2 ppt WoW), yet uplift steady at +0.3 %.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 76 %; premiums 19.4 % despite 5.8 ppt parity improvement MoM.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 78 %; premiums 20.2 % though uplift modest at +0.26 %.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 88 %; premiums 10.4 % at +0.29 %, flat over four weeks.
Best parity at 90 %; premiums 9.0 % but highest uplift at +0.38 %.
